title.narrative: 5.2 QUALITY Early Child Development (ECD) & F SERVICES

description.narrative: Increased availability of quality Early Child Development (ECD) services to children (0-6 years) and their families in targeted districts, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children and families, especially the most deprived, are utilizing quality Early Child Development (ECD) services

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
ECD advocacy and communication including campaigns

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased availability of quality ECD services to children (0-6 years) and their families in targeted districts

description.narrative: An additional 679 ECD spaces were established to increase children access to ECD services reaching a total of 22,557 children (0-6 years). A total of 149 caregivers were trained to provide quality ECD services. 552 home-based groups were established to enhance provision of parenting services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: of new ECD&F centres/spaces operational

target.value: 2018:15 ECD model centres, 500 home based ECD and 200 community/church based

actual.value: 2018:•18 model ECD centres established. Site for one centre in Bugesera has been allocated by the district authorities. Construction will commence during the last quarter of this year (currently hiring CSO partner). •6 low cost model centres have been established. Preparation for construction of addit

title.narrative: Percentage of districts implementing ECD packages for children at scale

actual.value: 2018:46.6%. Integrated ECD package implemented in 14 out of 30 districts with low ECD access and high levels of stunting

title.narrative: of caregivers trained to provide quality ECD services (disaggregated by gender )

actual.value: 2018:149 ECD caregivers, centre managers, and home visitors were trained, their performance is assessed through supportive supervision by recruited district supervisors. Almost 700 caregivers will be trained through the new PCAs with RICH, AVSI, Imbuto Foundation, ADEPE, CRS and CfC

title.narrative: Early Learning and Development Standards developed

actual.value: 2018:YES. In 2016 National ECD standards were developed and approved. Dissemination through multimedia is ongoing
